Contradict fact: The claim that Peter Strzok and Lisa Page "deleted all of their emails and text messages" is not supported by evidence and contradicts the fact that there is no definitive proof of such deletion.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the actions of Peter Strzok and Lisa Page by stating that they "illegally deleted" their emails and text messages, without providing sufficient evidence to support this accusation.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that Peter Strzok and Lisa Page deleted all of their emails and text messages.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the deletion of emails and text messages by Peter Strzok and Lisa Page was illegal, without providing any evidence or legal basis for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the alleged deletion of emails and text messages by Peter Strzok and Lisa Page, such as technical issues, accidental deletion, or routine data management processes.
